fields.summary: Allow grouping of plugins in the admin interface via info in the atlassian-plugin.xml
Allow plugins to specifiy dependency information and check prior to loading
Allow interception of page after rendering for plugin post-processing

fields.description:
From Dan Hardiker in email:

Configurable Plugins (and Plugin Modules)
Currently if you build a theme you can give it an action which will become a "configure" link in the theme selection page. Having a similar "configure" link appear next to Enable/Disable on both the plugin overview at the top as well as the individual modules (where defined). This would enable me to write a sudoku puzzle macro and have a configure link to set the default difficulty.
fields.summary: Make Plugins configurable from the admin interface

fields.description:
Edit a page (rws in test space for example).  
1) Cancel button at bottom of screen does not work.
2) Clicking anywhere along the Labels line acts like clicking on the EDIT/DONE button
3) WYSIWYG text color does not work
4) WYSIWYG panel or code formating does not work

View page
1) view changes link does not work correctly
fields.summary: View/Edit page problems 2.0rc1

fields.description:
This predominantly affects the unit tests, but if a Space did not have a home page and the orphaned pages query was performed, no results would be returned, because the "page.space.homePage != page" WHERE clause does not resolve to true when the home page is null.

This needs to be changed so it checks if the home page is null, or the home page is not the current page.
fields.summary: Orphaned pages query does not work when there is no space home page defined

fields.description:
1. Create a new page, type a few characters, double click to select them, click the colour button, choose a colour.
The colour is correctly chosen, but all other styling is lost, and no other characters can be entered.

This works in IE
fields.summary: Setting colours in Firefox doesn't work well

fields.description:
On this page: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/Alternative+JIRA+Clients

The link at the bottom: http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/createpage-entervariables.action?spaceKey=JIRAEXT&templateName=Extension+Template&fromPageId=11611

Should create a new page with the correct parentPage and using a Template. However, it does neither. It just goes to a regular blank create page screen.
fields.summary: A link to automatically create a page with a template no longer works

fields.description: There is no longer a template link on the create new page view.
fields.summary: The link to populate a page from a template is missing on c.a.c.

fields.description:

From the new space's home page, click Add Page.
Enter a unique name for the new page.
Add some meaningless content to the page.
Click Save.

fields.description:

fields.description:
The attachments macro has a patterns field which is supposed to allow matching via regular expressions. Unfortunately, the way confluence handles characters keeps this from being useful.

It can be used to do something simple like "list only documents ending with doc".
Example: patterns=.*doc (works correctly)

but anything more useful like "list all documents except word and excel documents" cannot be done:
Example: patterns!=.*\.(doc)|(xls) (completely fails)

The reasons this fails are listed:
A) We cannot use !=
B) We cannot use \ (backslash) anywhere in the regular expression (which makes it hard to do anything halfway complex)
C) We cannot use | (pipe) anywhere because confluence uses it as the seperator for fields for macros

The basic functions that someone might use this for (listing all files except those of a certain type or types) do not function because the regular expression handling does not work correctly.
fields.summary: Support using pipe "|" and backslash "\" in macro parameters for regular expressions, wiki links, etc.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4358].
  {panel}

At present, the {dynamictasklist} macro is only usable with a mouse. It would be nice to have some keyboard accessibility on there, specifically:

Add onkeypress attributes to the task status (complete/incomplete icon button) and delete link for each task. The onkeypress handler would do exactly the same as the onclick handler - a very quick way to add keyboard interactivity, at least for javascript enabled browsers.

In addition, the two links (task status and delete task) should also be given titles - not only will this allow for a more descriptive tooltip to be displayed, but it also aids people with screen readers, braillers, etc. Again, very simple to add.

In the "add task" box, it would be nice if the "Add Task" text was defined as a label with an attribute of for="newtask" and then give the input with name task an id="newTask" attrib. This is a very quick way to help people with screen readers, braillers, etc., know what the label relates to and also select the textbox.

The next bit isn't so simple (and as such is probably better farmed off to a sub-task of this issue) - compatibility with javascript-disabled browsers....

Your <a> tags for setting task status and deleting tasks currently have a href="#" which will obviously do nothing if there is no javascript support. For the task status, could you have the href set to a server side action that toggles the task status as part of a screen refresh? That way, if the user has JS enabled, they use the dynamic way of doing things, if they don't have JS they see the page refresh.

I'm guessing the delete task link would be slightly more complex - it will need a page displaying that asks if the user is sure they want to delete in the middle.

See also: CONF-4357
fields.summary: Improved accessibility for {dynamictasklist} macro
Make dynamictasklist's collapsable

fields.description:
It would be great if all the standard macros that come with Confluence (e.g. {children}, {color}, etc) were open sourced and their development made independent from the main Confluence branch. This would provide several advantages:

1. Smaller fixes/feature requests can be added and released between major releases of Confluence
2. The need to create similar, but slightly different or slightly enhanced versions of the same macro will be eliminated (eg {no-parents} in the Navigation Macros on CONFEXT vs. {children})
3. There will be less of a barrier to getting 'trivial' enhancement requests, since the requestors can write the addition themselves.
4. Non-Atlassian developers can contribute patches and enhancements, allowing Atlassian to focus on adding that latest cool feature to Confluence.

They can still be included with the standard distributions of Confluence, and installed by default in the WEB-INF/lib directory. But this way, administrators can replace the 'plugins-*.jar' files with updated versions themselves if needed. Currently, you have to have the source code and you'll have to merge it with any Atlassian changes every time a release comes out.

You may want to establish some basic ground rules for modifying the macros. Eg. all changes should be backwards-compatible. Some well-placed test cases should help with this.
fields.summary: Open source the standard Confluence plugins and macros

If confluence should be used for documentation, there is one important feature missing. Many documantation have to approved or signed by users before they can be applied.

It would be great to add an approval/sign function to pages:

- Add version to page info tab (recent changes or page history)
- Show all users who approved/rejected a page version in page info tab (recent changes or page history)
- Show version in page

fields.description:
To install the Agitar plugins for Eclipse we need to create an update site.

   # From the Eclipse menu navigate to Help > Software Updates > Find and Install...
   # Select Search for new features to install and click Next.
   # Click the New Remote Site button and enter the following in the dialog:\\
      Name: Agitar\\
      URL: http://www.agitar.com/products/updates

   # Select the Agitar update if not already selected and click Finish.
   # In the Search Results dialog select the Agitar entry and click Next.
   # Accept the license and click Next.
   # Change the install location to <working directory>/eclipse-plugins.
   # Click Finish to download and install the plugin(s). When downloading is complete you may be asked to apply the changes or restart eclipse. It is not known whether it is safe to simply apply the changes therefore restarting eclipse is the recommended option.
=================================================================================================
The above wiki code renders as the following.  However the numbering is broken by the inclusion of a link.  Originally we were  using a {panel}, but that broke the numbering too.  Hopefully there is a workaround or a fix forthcoming becasue we have not had any issuses using APT (Almost Plain Text) to accomplish the same behavior.
=================================================================================================

To install the Agitar plugins for Eclipse we need to create an update site.

   1. From the Eclipse menu navigate to Help > Software Updates > Find and Install...
   2. Select Search for new features to install and click Next.
   3. Click the New Remote Site button and enter the following in the dialog:
      Name: Agitar
      URL: http://www.agitar.com/products/updates

   1. Select the Agitar update if not already selected and click Finish.
   2. In the Search Results dialog select the Agitar entry and click Next.
   3. Accept the license and click Next.
   4. Change the install location to <working directory>/eclipse-plugins.
   5. Click Finish to download and install the plugin(s). When downloading is complete you may be asked to apply the changes or restart eclipse. It is not known whether it is safe to simply apply the changes therefore restarting eclipse is the recommended option.
fields.summary: Wiki numbering broken with links

fields.description:
I recently configured a space-pop-mail-account but not knowing the password I left it "broken".

Now, due to an OutOfMemoryError (already reported at support.atlassian.com) I had to restart the Tomcat-server. This failed due to the exception below. It seems as if because of this wrong password Confluence won't startup at all. There should be a robust error handling so that I can at least change the password inside Confluence.

Workaround: Go to the <confluence-home>/config/<Space Key>-directory and edit the confluence-space.bandana.xml. As the password is clear-text I just had to enter the correct password. Perhaps an alternative is to completely delete the <popMailAccount>-entry.

fields.description:
Joda 0.98 produces incorrect formatting for certain date patterns - but only on some platforms. On Windows and OSX it will work correctly. But on Linux and FreeBSD it will render incorrectly. 

For example, try rendering any date with the date pattern "MMM" or "MMMM". You should get the month being one month previous to what is expected (eg. January 24, 2005 will produce "Dec"). I can understand why Joda 1.x has not been upgraded to, since it breaks the API from 0.98, but 0.98 is inherrently untrustable, making it pretty much useless...
fields.summary: Joda Time 0.98 produces incorrect formatting for some dates.
